pages.text: The unique properties of covalence dust make it useful for quite a few things. Amongst them is the notoriously monotonous task of mining. Simply shaping some vibrant wood in a certain way, then applying a fair amount of low covalence dust, will create a stick known as a divining rod.

Using the rod is rather simple, simply using it on a block will have it inspect a 3 cubic meter area, and will then vibrate. The exact meaning of this vibration is not entirely understood, but stronger vibrations generally seem to correlate with rarer minerals.

Applying higher tier dusts to the divining rod seems to empower it, changing its vibration patterns and increasing its range with each upgrade. The range of these stronger rods can be changed by pressing the change mode key.$(br2)Unfortunately, nobody has yet been able to decipher the meaning of the extra vibrations, as they seem somewhat arbitrary. $(#b52f6d)Perhaps there is a method to the madness, but we just do not know everything about it yet?
$(philo)the mortals were on the right track, these vibrations correspond to the emc value of detected blocks.
